column4: Germany removes Tesla from subsidies list as too pricey
column5: BERLIN A German government agency has removed Tesla from the list of electric cars eligible for subsidies  sparking a row with the U.S. company over whether its Model S is too expensive to qualify for the scheme.

column4: UPDATE 1-Germany removes Tesla from subsidies list as too pricey
column5: * Tesla denies this  says drivers can buy no-frills version (Recasts  adds Tesla response  background on subsidy programme)

column4: BRIEF-Tesla denies Model S base version not available in Germany
column5: * SAYS IT IS "COMPLETELY FALSE" THAT ITS MODEL S IS NOT AVAILABLE IN BASE VERSION IN GERMANY Further company coverage:

column4: Intel cuts stake in ASML to below 5 percent
column5: AMSTERDAM Chipmaker Intel  has cut its stake in Dutch semiconductor equipment supplier ASML  to 4.96 percent  according to a filing published by the Dutch Financial Markets Authority on Friday.

column4: Intel cuts stake in ASML to below 5 pct
column5: AMSTERDAM  Dec 1 Chipmaker Intel has cut its stake in Dutch semiconductor equipment supplier ASML to 4.96 percent  according to a filing published by the Dutch Financial Markets Authority on Friday.
